items.name: Reset to default (Fortnite 1920x1080)
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Fortnite – Presets
items.description: [Default] Writes 1920x1080 native resolution to GameUserSettings.ini.

steps.command: $path = Join-Path $env:LOCALAPPDATA 'FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient\GameUserSettings.ini'; if (!(Test-Path $path)) { Write-Output 'GameUserSettings.ini not found.'; return } $content = Get-Content $path; $kv = @{ 'ResolutionSizeX'='1920'; 'ResolutionSizeY'='1080'; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeX'='1920'; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeY'='1080'; 'DesiredScreenWidth'='1920'; 'DesiredScreenHeight'='1080'; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenWidth'='1920'; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenHeight'='1080'; 'FullscreenMode'='0' }; foreach($k in $kv.Keys){ $pattern = '^' + $k + '='; $replacement = $k + '=' + $kv[$k]; $found = $false; $content = $content | ForEach-Object { if ($_ -like ($k + '=*')) { $found = $true; $replacement } else { $_ } }; if (-not $found) { $content += $replacement } } Set-Content -Path $path -Value $content -Encoding ASCII; Write-Output 'Applied 1920x1080 stretched for Fortnite.'

items.name: Revert Fortnite to native resolution
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Fortnite – Presets
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Tries to reset GameUserSettings.ini resolution keys to the current primary display resolution.

steps.command: $scr = Get-CimInstance -ClassName Win32_VideoController | Sort-Object -Property CurrentHorizontalResolution -Descending | Select-Object -First 1; if (-not $scr -or -not $scr.CurrentHorizontalResolution) { Write-Output 'Could not detect current display resolution.'; return } $w = [int]$scr.CurrentHorizontalResolution; $h = [int]$scr.CurrentVerticalResolution; $path = Join-Path $env:LOCALAPPDATA 'FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient\GameUserSettings.ini'; if (!(Test-Path $path)) { Write-Output 'GameUserSettings.ini not found.'; return } $content = Get-Content $path; $kv = @{ 'ResolutionSizeX'=$w; 'ResolutionSizeY'=$h; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeX'=$w; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeY'=$h; 'DesiredScreenWidth'=$w; 'DesiredScreenHeight'=$h; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenWidth'=$w; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenHeight'=$h; 'FullscreenMode'='0' }; foreach($k in $kv.Keys){ $replacement = $k + '=' + $kv[$k]; $content = $content | ForEach-Object { if ($_ -like ($k + '=*')) { $replacement } else { $_ } }; if (-not ($content -match ('^' + [regex]::Escape($k) + '='))) { $content += $replacement } } Set-Content -Path $path -Value $content -Encoding ASCII; Write-Output ('Reset Fortnite resolution to {0}x{1}.' -f $w,$h)

Use this method description inside Falcon Optimizer: open your GPU control panel, enable GPU scaling, then set a lower resolution in-game and select Fullscreen. This entry is documentation only and does not change system files.
"@

These presets edit %LOCALAPPDATA%/FortniteGame/Saved/Config/WindowsClient/GameUserSettings.ini with clean, reversible key writes instead of replacing the entire file.
"@

Hybrid method: 1) Turn on GPU scaling & Fullscreen in your driver panel, 2) Use a Falcon preset (e.g., Bugha/Clix/Martoz) to force the exact stretched resolution via GameUserSettings.ini.
"@

items.name: Open Valorant config folder
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Valorant – Tools
items.description: [Focus: Control] Opens the Valorant configuration folder so you can inspect or adjust video/resolution settings directly.

items.name: Valorant stretch – methods overview
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Valorant – Methods
items.description: [Focus: Info] Explains how to use in-game resolutions and GPU scaling to achieve stretch or black bars safely in Valorant.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
VALORANT STRETCH OVERVIEW:
- Use Fullscreen (not borderless) in Valorant video settings.
- Pick a 4:3 or 16:10 resolution (e.g. 1280x960, 1440x1080, 1600x900).
- In your GPU control panel, choose either full-panel stretch or preserve aspect ratio:
  * Full-panel stretch = stretched image, wider models.
  * Preserve aspect ratio = black bars, but no distortion.
- Avoid random config packs from the internet; use your own settings or Falcon presets.
"@

items.name: GPU vs display scaling – explained
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Global GPU Scaling
items.description: [Focus: Info] Explains GPU vs display scaling, when to use each, and how it affects stretched resolutions in games.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
GPU VS DISPLAY SCALING:
- GPU scaling: the graphics card scales the image before sending it to the monitor.
  * Good for consistent stretch across different monitors.
  * Often required for clean stretch in Fortnite/Valorant.
- Display scaling: the monitor scales the incoming signal itself.
  * Behavior changes by monitor model; can look different between setups.
- For competitive use, enable GPU scaling where possible and then pick your stretched resolution preset in Falcon.
"@

items.name: Fix blur from DPI scaling (Windows tip)
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Global GPU Scaling
items.description: [Focus: Clarity] Explains how to reduce blur caused by high DPI scaling when using stretched resolutions.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
FIXING BLUR FROM DPI SCALING:
- Some games look blurry at stretched resolutions because of Windows DPI scaling.
- To reduce blur:
  1) Right-click the game EXE -> Properties.
  2) Go to the Compatibility tab.
  3) Click 'Change high DPI settings'.
  4) Enable 'Override high DPI scaling behavior' and set it to 'Application'.
- This often makes stretched resolutions look sharper and less smeared.
"@

items.name: Open Fortnite GameUserSettings.ini
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Custom Builder
items.description: [Focus: Advanced] Opens the Fortnite GameUserSettings.ini file so you can create a fully custom stretched resolution.

items.name: How to build a custom stretch (Fortnite)
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Custom Builder
items.description: [Focus: Guide] Step-by-step instructions for manually creating any custom stretched resolution in Fortnite.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
CUSTOM FORTNITE STRETCH (MANUAL):
- Close Fortnite before editing.
- Open GameUserSettings.ini (use the button above or open it from %LOCALAPPDATA%\FortniteGame...).
- Find and edit ALL of these keys to your target resolution (e.g. 1520x1080):
  * ResolutionSizeX / ResolutionSizeY
  * LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeX / Y
  * DesiredScreenWidth / DesiredScreenHeight
  * LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenWidth / Height
- Set FullscreenMode=0 for true fullscreen.
- Save the file, then launch Fortnite and use Fullscreen in video settings.
"@

items.name: Open CS2 config folder
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / CS2 – Tools
items.description: [Focus: Control] Tries to open the most common Counter-Strike 2 config folder so you can adjust video / resolution settings or autoexec files yourself.

items.name: CS2 stretch – methods overview
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / CS2 – Methods
items.description: [Focus: Info] Explains common Counter-Strike 2 stretching methods and what they do for model width and visibility.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
CS2 STRETCH OVERVIEW:
- Use your GPU control panel (NVIDIA, AMD, Intel) to pick Full-panel scaling or Keep aspect ratio.
- In CS2 video settings, you can pick:
  * 4:3 or 5:4 resolution for classic stretched models.
  * 16:9 native if you want less distortion but cleaner image.
- For true stretch:
  * Set GPU scaling to Full-panel.
  * Pick 4:3 res like 1280x960 or 1024x768.
  * Use Fullscreen or Exclusive Fullscreen where available.
- If you use autoexec:
  * Keep your -w / -h launch options in sync with your chosen stretch res.
  * Avoid random config packs from the internet; use your own settings.
"@

items.description: Copies generic Steam-style launch options to clipboard (works for many PC games).

steps.command: Set-Clipboard -Value "-w 1600 -h 900 -fullscreen"; Write-Output "Copied launch options for Any Game: -w 1600 -h 900 -fullscreen"

items.name: 1656x1080 (Fortnite)
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / Fortnite – Presets
items.description: [Focus: FPS/Visibility] Writes 1656x1080 to GameUserSettings.ini (backup saved). Popular/pro-style: Popular comp 16:10-ish.

steps.command: $path = Join-Path $env:LOCALAPPDATA 'FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient\GameUserSettings.ini'; if (!(Test-Path $path)) { Write-Output 'GameUserSettings.ini not found.'; return } $bakDir = Join-Path $env:ProgramData 'FalconOptimizer\stretch_backups'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $bakDir | Out-Null; $bak = Join-Path $bakDir ('GameUserSettings_' + (Get-Date).ToString('yyyyMMdd_HHmmss') + '.ini'); Copy-Item $path $bak -Force; $content = Get-Content $path; $kv = @{ 'ResolutionSizeX'='1656'; 'ResolutionSizeY'='1080'; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeX'='1656'; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeY'='1080'; 'DesiredScreenWidth'='1656'; 'DesiredScreenHeight'='1080'; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenWidth'='1656'; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenHeight'='1080'; 'FullscreenMode'='0' }; foreach($k in $kv.Keys){ $replacement = $k + '=' + $kv[$k]; $found = $false; $content = $content | ForEach-Object { if ($_ -like ($k + '=*')) { $found = $true; $replacement } else { $_ } }; if (-not $found) { $content += $replacement } } Set-Content -Path $path -Value $content -Encoding ASCII; Write-Output 'Applied 1656x1080 stretched for Fortnite.'; Write-Output ('Backup: ' + $bak)

items.name: GTA V 1280x960 (apply settings.xml)
items.category: Stretch Resolution Lab / GTA V – Presets
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Writes 1280x960 to GTA V settings.xml (backup saved).

steps.command: $path = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE 'Documents\\Rockstar Games\\GTA V\\settings.xml'; if (!(Test-Path $path)) { Write-Output 'GTA V settings.xml not found.'; return } $bakDir = Join-Path $env:ProgramData 'FalconOptimizer\\stretch_backups'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $bakDir | Out-Null; $bak = Join-Path $bakDir ('GTAV_settings_1280x960_' + (Get-Date).ToString('yyyyMMdd_HHmmss') + '.xml'); Copy-Item $path $bak -Force; $xml = Get-Content $path -Raw; $xml = $xml -replace '<screenWidth>\d+</screenWidth>', '<screenWidth>1280</screenWidth>'; $xml = $xml -replace '<screenHeight>\d+</screenHeight>', '<screenHeight>960</screenHeight>'; Set-Content -Path $path -Value $xml -Encoding UTF8; Write-Output 'Applied GTA V 1280x960.'; Write-Output ('Backup: ' + $bak);
